Jameson_Clark_(singer):
{{short description|American country music singer|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jameson Clark | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = | birth_place = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1972}}{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|year=2008|page=94|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} | origin = [[Starr, South Carolina]] | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2001–present | label = [[Capitol Records|Capitol]] | associated_acts = }} '''Jameson Clark''' (born 1972 in [[Starr, South Carolina]]) is an American [[country music]] singer. Between 2001 and 2002, he recorded for [[Capitol Records]] and charted two singles: "Don't Play Any Love Songs" and "You da Man", in addition to releasing an album titled ''Workin' on a Groove''.{{cite web|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p420589|pure_url=yes}}|title=Jameson Clark biography|last=MacNeil|first=Jason|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=September 24, 2010}} Ray Waddell of ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' magazine gave ''Workin' on a Groove'' a mostly-positive review, saying that Clark "is having himself a good ol' time".{{cite magazine|last=Waddell|first=Ray|date=November 2, 2002|title=Album reviews — ''Workin' on a Groove''|magazine=Billboard|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NQ0EAAAAMBAJ&dq=%22jameson+clark%22+%22you+da+man%22&pg=PA19}} It also received a positive review from Matt Bjorke of [[About.com]], who compared Clark's sound to [[Dwight Yoakam]], [[Toby Keith]], and [[Hank Williams III]].{{cite web|url=http://countrymusic.about.com/library/bljamesonclarkrev.htm|title=''Workin' on a Groove'' review|last=Bjorke|first=Matt|work=About.com|accessdate=September 24, 2010|archive-date=January 18, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118095133/http://countrymusic.about.com/library/bljamesonclarkrev.htm|url-status=dead}} ==''Workin' on a Groove'' (2002)== {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = ''Workin' on a Groove'' | type = studio | artist = Jameson Clark | cover = | alt = | released = {{Start date|2002|10|08}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = Country | length = | label = Capitol No. 32301 | producer = Jameson Clark
